original: Ekelöf, Johan Adolf August Stig, professor, tekn. dr, Göteborg, f. 19/1/ 04 i Gbg av civ :ing. John E. o. ELla Landgraff. G. 1. 30 m. Elli von Goet-ze; 2. 39 m. Lillemor Rohtenberg. Barn: Barbro f. 32, Per Johan 41, Anders 44, Kristina 45. — Stud :ex. 21, avg:ex. fr. KTH 25, fil. kand. 28, res:-off:ex. 28, tekn. dr o. doc. i teor. elektrotekn. 38. Föret. div. res. i Europa samt t. USA 38 (Sv:e-Amer. stift, stip.) o. 46. Assist, h. prof. W. Weibull 27-28, ing. v. Telefon A-B L. M. Ericsson 29-33, lär. v. AIHS 32-43, tf. prof. v. KTH 39-40, lektor i el:-tekn. m. teletekn. v. tekn. lärov. i Sthlm 41-43, prof. i elektr :lära o. elektr. mättekn. v. CTH sed. 43. Led. av 43’ åris oiff :iuitbiM:n :-sakk. siamt 47 års matem :maskinutredn. Skr.: On the transients of an inductively shun-ted el. transmiss. line (grad:avh. 37) samt ett 10-tal avh. i teor. el:tekn.
translated: Ekelöf, Johan Adolf August Stig, professor, PhD, Gothenburg, born January 19, 1904 in Gothenburg to civil engineer John E. and Ella Landgraff. Married 1st to Elli von Goet-ze in 1930, and 2nd to Lillemor Rohtenberg in 1939. Children: Barbro born in 1932, Per Johan in 1941, Anders in 1944, and Kristina in 1945. Completed secondary school in 1921, graduated from KTH in 1925, earned a bachelor's degree in 1928, completed reserve officer training in 1928, earned a PhD and became a docent in theoretical electrical engineering in 1938. Completed various research trips to Europe and the United States in 1938 (commissioned by the Swedish-America Foundation). Was assistant and associate professor under W. Weibull from 1927-1928, worked as an engineer for Telefon AB L. M. Ericsson from 1929-1933, taught at AIHS from 1932-1943, was acting professor at KTH from 1939-1940, was a lecturer in electrical engineering and telecommunications at a technical school in Stockholm from 1941-1943, and became a professor of electrical theory and electrical measurement technology at CTH in 1943. Was a member of the 1943 telecommunications investigation committee and the 1947 mathematical computing investigation committee. Wrote "On the transients of an inductively shunted el. transmiss. line" as a doctoral thesis in 1937, as well as 10 other works related to theoretical electrical engineering.

structured.name: Johan Adolf August Stig Ekelöf
structured.description: Swedish professor and PhD in Theoretical Electrical Engineering
